summary: The document is a classified CIA report from October 1964, detailing the activities and background of Fernando FUENTES Coba, a former Cuban Intelligence Service officer. It outlines his roles in the Cuban Police Force, including his work in the Confidential Department, his discharge due to alleged drug-related issues, his involvement in immigration fraud through document forgery, and his later relocation to Halifax, Canada. The report also mentions his role in the return of American flyer Rafael del PINO to Cuba, which led to his position in the Cuban G-2's Confidential Bureau.
key_findings: Fernando FUENTES Coba served as a lieutenant in the Cuban Police Force and worked in the Confidential Department under Commander Efigenio ALMEJEIRAS.
He was allegedly discharged from his position due to drug-related problems.
FUENTES was involved in forging birth certificates to facilitate illegal entry of Cuban nationals into the United States.
He played a key role in the return of American flyer Rafael del PINO to Cuba, which resulted in his appointment to the Cuban G-2's Confidential Bureau.
By 1964, FUENTES was reported to be residing and employed in Halifax, Canada.
